doc.field: Peace talks for Columbia start in Mainz

Discussions aimed at attaining peace in Columbia began on Sunday afternoon in Mainz. Participating in the talks are representatives of the rebels as well as members of the government of the South American country. The discussions which are to last four days will investigate perspectives for ending the armed conflict in Columbia. The meeting was initiated by the German Bishops' Conference. A preliminary first meeting was held last month in Mainz.
Waigel proposed adjustment of EU contributions

In the dispute regarding future financing of the EU budget, German Minister of Finance Theo Waigel has rejected demands by Southern European states. Portugal and Greece support the proposition by Spain to calculate contributions based on the per-capita income of a member state. Mr. Waigel told the newspaper "Welt am Sonntag" that is completely unrealistic. This would mean that Germany would have to contribute up to 8 billion Marks more. Mr. Waigel stressed that he will lobby hard to reduce the burden on Germany. With a net contribution of 22 billion Marks, Germany contributes the most European Union coffers.
Legal limits for radioactivity too high

According to experts, the risks of radiation are higher than was believed so far. They say that the legal limits have to be tightened. The laws defining those limits have been based on incorrect data. Radiation experts have pointed out that present limits were set in the 50s. At that time it was not known that low doses of radiation can cause cancer. New insights from Hiroshima, nuclear tests and the reactor accident of Chernobyl have not been taken into account when the limits were put into law.
Hospital surcharge can be deducted from taxes

The special fee which members of public health insurances for the maintenance of hospitals have to pay can be deducted from taxes. A spokesman of the Ministry of Finance confirmed the validity of a newspaper report today in Bonn which claims that the so-called hospital emergency fund of 20 Marks can be deducted from annual taxes in the same way health insurance premiums are deducted. The surcharge has to be paid in 1997, 1998 and 1999 by approximately 40 million medically insured. It does not have to be paid by civil servants and members of private health insurance schemes.
Kanther: few right-wing extremists in German hooligan scene

According to German Minister of the Interior Klaus Kanther, the German hooligan scene has not been infested by right-wing extremists. This has been validated by a central database at the Criminal Police Agency in Duesseldorf, Mr. Kanther told "Deutschlandfunk" radio. Of the 2300 violent criminals who have come to attention in the whole of Germany, only a small percentage are politically right-wing.
Formula 1: Schumacher wins British Grand Prix
Michael Schumacher has won the British Grand Prix in Silverstone. Schumacher, driving Ferrari, has now overtaken the Finn Mika Haekkinen in the overall ratings with a two-point lead.
Tennis: Becker defeated at final in Gstaad
Boris Becker has missed his sixth chance at winning a title on a sand court. He was defeated at the finals in Gstaad, Switzerland by the Spaniard Alex Corretja by 6:7, 5:7 and 3:6.
Triathlon: Zeck wins Iron Man Europe again
Juergen Zeck from Koblenz has won the Iron Man Europe Triathlon in Roth, Germany. The 33-year-old took eight hours and four minutes to swim 3,5 km, , cycle 80 km and run 42 km.
